title: The Beach Boys‚Äô Brian Wilson Remembered by Bob Dylan, Al Jardine, John Cusack, and More
description: Mike Love, Sean Ono Lennon, Jeff Rosenstock, Ekko Astral‚Äôs Jael Holzman, and others have also shared tributes to Wilson
author: Matthew Strauss
excerpt: Mike Love, Sean Ono Lennon, Jeff Rosenstock, Ekko Astral‚Äôs Jael Holzman, and others have also shared tributes to Wilson
text: Following the news of Brian Wilson‚Äôs death, figures from across the music landscape are paying tribute to the iconic Beach Boys musician. ‚ÄúAnyone who really knows me knows how heart broken I am about Brian Wilson passing,‚Äù wrote Sean Ono Lennon, whose late father, John Lennon, was a Wilson contemporary and known Beach Boys fan. ‚ÄúNot many people influenced me as much as he did. I feel very lucky that I was able to meet him and spend some time with him. He was always very kind and generous. He was our American Mozart. A one of a kind genius from another world.‚Äù‚ÄúThe maestro has passed - Brian was a raw open heart with two legs - and an ear that heard the angels - quite literally.‚Äù John Cusack, who played Wilson in Love & Mercy, wrote. ‚ÄúHe was touched. To see him so happy with his wife Melinda - finally talking about and performing his unfinished masterpiece Smile , (after the release of the astounding Smile sessions) - to hear him be so open about the depth of his struggles so that the telling of his story might help others and take away the stigma of mental health - was to see a triumph of endurance and spirit , love and Mercy .‚ÄùBob Dylan shared on X: ‚ÄúHeard the sad news about Brian today and thought about all the years I‚Äôve been listening to him and admiring his genius. Rest in peace dear Brian.‚ÄùOne of Wilson‚Äôs former Beach Boys bandmates, Al Jardine, said in a press statement: ‚ÄúBrian Wilson, my friend, my classmate, my football teammate, my Beach Boy bandmate and my brother in spirit, I will always feel blessed that you were in our lives for as long as you were. I think the most comforting thought right now is that you are reunited with Carl and Dennis, singing those beautiful harmonies again. You were a humble giant who always made me laugh and we will celebrate your music forever. Brian, I‚Äôll really miss you‚Ä¶still I have the warmth of the sun within me tonight ‚òÄÔ∏è üé∂ ‚ù§Ô∏è.‚ÄùAnother former bandmate, Mike Love, wrote, in part, on Instagram, ‚ÄúToday, the world lost a genius, and I lost a cousin by blood and my partner in music.‚Äù He added, ‚ÄúBrian Wilson wasn‚Äôt just the heart of The Beach Boys‚Äîhe was the soul of our sound.‚Äù‚ÄúI‚Äôve know the Beach boys since the mid 60‚Äôs and have done lots of shows with them,‚Äù Bachman-Turner Overdrive‚Äôs Randy Bachman shared. ‚ÄúThey were the American answer to the Beatles. They wowed everyone with the songs, structures, vocals harmonies. The sunshine sound. I remember when Brian decided to not go on the road anymore but continued to write incredible music. They were like family.‚ÄùQuestlove also posted a lengthy message about Brian Wilson and his own experiences with the 1966 masterpiece Pet Sounds. ‚Äúif there was a human being who made art out of inexpressible sadness‚Ä¶.damn it was Brian Wilson,‚Äù the Roots‚Äô drummer wrote. ‚ÄúI hate he went thru what he went thru to create this album (also: Smile Outakes in my North Star) but man‚Äî‚Äîwithout him I dunno how so many that came after felt safe to express a feeling of sadness that most humans would be otherwise ridiculed/punished for.‚ÄùSpeaking with Rolling Stone, the Beach Boys‚Äô former manager Fred Vail said, ‚ÄúSixty-two years, that‚Äôs how long we were buddies. Some great memories, some great moments. They all fly back at me: meeting them at the old house in Hawthorne; sitting on the floor at Capitol, when he mastered Pet Sounds; at Columbia, when we recorded ‚ÄòGood Vibrations‚Äô; and then all the shows at the auditorium in Sacramento that I emceed.‚ÄùSir Lucian Grainge, the chairman and chief executive of Universal Music Group, said in a statement: ‚ÄúBrian Wilson was one of the most talented singer-songwriters in the history of recorded music. Not only did his songs capture the spirit of youth, joy and longing in ways that still inspire millions of fans around the world, his innovative work in the studio transformed the way musicians record even to this day. Brian made an indelible mark, and our thoughts are with his family in this time of loss.‚ÄùAdditional figures to pay tribute to Wilson include Nancy Sinatra, Fleetwood Mac‚Äôs Mick Fleetwood, Jeff Rosenstock, the Walkmen‚Äôs Hamilton Leithauser, Primal Scream, the Avalanches, Dam Funk, the Velvet Underground‚Äôs John Cale, the Rolling Stones‚Äô Ronnie Wood, Home Is Where, No Joy‚Äôs Jasamine White-Gluz, Anamanaguchi, Ekko Astral‚Äôs Jael Holzman, Speedy Ortiz‚Äôs Sadie Dupuis, the Beatles‚Äô Ringo Starr, and the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Foundation.
html:
Following the news of Brian Wilson‚Äôs death, figures from across the music landscape are paying tribute to the iconic Beach Boys musician. ‚ÄúAnyone who really knows me knows how heart broken I am about Brian Wilson passing,‚Äù wrote Sean Ono Lennon, whose late father, John Lennon, was a Wilson contemporary and known Beach Boys fan. ‚ÄúNot many people influenced me as much as he did. I feel very lucky that I was able to meet him and spend some time with him. He was always very kind and generous. He was our American Mozart. A one of a kind genius from another world.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe maestro has passed - Brian was a raw open heart with two legs - and an ear that heard the angels - quite literally.‚Äù John Cusack, who played Wilson in Love & Mercy, wrote. ‚ÄúHe was touched. To see him so happy with his wife Melinda - finally talking about and performing his unfinished masterpiece Smile , (after the release of the astounding Smile sessions) - to hear him be so open about the depth of his struggles so that the telling of his story might help others and take away the stigma of mental health - was to see a triumph of endurance and spirit , love and Mercy .‚Äù

Bob Dylan shared on X: ‚ÄúHeard the sad news about Brian today and thought about all the years I‚Äôve been listening to him and admiring his genius. Rest in peace dear Brian.‚Äù

One of Wilson‚Äôs former Beach Boys bandmates, Al Jardine, said in a press statement: ‚ÄúBrian Wilson, my friend, my classmate, my football teammate, my Beach Boy bandmate and my brother in spirit, I will always feel blessed that you were in our lives for as long as you were. I think the most comforting thought right now is that you are reunited with Carl and Dennis, singing those beautiful harmonies again. You were a humble giant who always made me laugh and we will celebrate your music forever. Brian, I‚Äôll really miss you‚Ä¶still I have the warmth of the sun within me tonight ‚òÄÔ∏è üé∂ ‚ù§Ô∏è.‚Äù

Another former bandmate, Mike Love, wrote, in part, on Instagram, ‚ÄúToday, the world lost a genius, and I lost a cousin by blood and my partner in music.‚Äù He added, ‚ÄúBrian Wilson wasn‚Äôt just the heart of The Beach Boys‚Äîhe was the soul of our sound.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve know the Beach boys since the mid 60‚Äôs and have done lots of shows with them,‚Äù Bachman-Turner Overdrive‚Äôs Randy Bachman shared. ‚ÄúThey were the American answer to the Beatles. They wowed everyone with the songs, structures, vocals harmonies. The sunshine sound. I remember when Brian decided to not go on the road anymore but continued to write incredible music. They were like family.‚Äù

Questlove also posted a lengthy message about Brian Wilson and his own experiences with the 1966 masterpiece Pet Sounds. ‚Äúif there was a human being who made art out of inexpressible sadness‚Ä¶.damn it was Brian Wilson,‚Äù the Roots‚Äô drummer wrote. ‚ÄúI hate he went thru what he went thru to create this album (also: Smile Outakes in my North Star) but man‚Äî‚Äîwithout him I dunno how so many that came after felt safe to express a feeling of sadness that most humans would be otherwise ridiculed/punished for.‚Äù

Speaking with Rolling Stone, the Beach Boys‚Äô former manager Fred Vail said, ‚ÄúSixty-two years, that‚Äôs how long we were buddies. Some great memories, some great moments. They all fly back at me: meeting them at the old house in Hawthorne; sitting on the floor at Capitol, when he mastered Pet Sounds; at Columbia, when we recorded ‚ÄòGood Vibrations‚Äô; and then all the shows at the auditorium in Sacramento that I emceed.‚Äù

Sir Lucian Grainge, the chairman and chief executive of Universal Music Group, said in a statement: ‚ÄúBrian Wilson was one of the most talented singer-songwriters in the history of recorded music. Not only did his songs capture the spirit of youth, joy and longing in ways that still inspire millions of fans around the world, his innovative work in the studio transformed the way musicians record even to this day. Brian made an indelible mark, and our thoughts are with his family in this time of loss.‚Äù

Additional figures to pay tribute to Wilson include Nancy Sinatra, Fleetwood Mac‚Äôs Mick Fleetwood, Jeff Rosenstock, the Walkmen‚Äôs Hamilton Leithauser, Primal Scream, the Avalanches, Dam Funk, the Velvet Underground‚Äôs John Cale, the Rolling Stones‚Äô Ronnie Wood, Home Is Where, No Joy‚Äôs Jasamine White-Gluz, Anamanaguchi, Ekko Astral‚Äôs Jael Holzman, Speedy Ortiz‚Äôs Sadie Dupuis, the Beatles‚Äô Ringo Starr, and the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Foundation.
